name: Transistor
description: Revolutionized electronics by replacing vacuum tubes.

name: Integrated Circuit (IC)
description: Miniaturized circuitry, leading to the modern computer era.

name: Microprocessor
description: Central processing unit on a single chip.

name: Personal Computer (PC)
description: Brought computing power to the masses.

name: Laptop
description: Portable computing.

name: Smartphone
description: Combined mobile phone technology with computing capabilities.

name: Tablet PC
description: Touchscreen mobile computer.

name: Arduino
description: Open-source electronics platform for building digital devices.

name: Raspberry Pi
description: Low-cost single-board computer for education and hobbyists.

name: Operating Systems
description: Examples include Unix, Windows, Linux.

name: Graphical User Interface (GUI)
description: Made computers more user-friendly.

name: Object-Oriented Programming (OOP)
description: New paradigm in software development.

name: Internet Protocol Suite (TCP/IP)
description: Fundamental technology for the Internet.

name: Web Browser
description: Enabled navigation of the World Wide Web.

name: Cloud Computing
description: Delivery of computing services over the Internet.

name: Virtual Reality (VR)
description: Immersive computer-generated simulation.

name: Augmented Reality (AR)
description: Enhances real-world environments with computer-generated information.

name: Neural Networks
description: Modeled after biological neural networks for AI.

name: Machine Learning
description: Algorithms that improve automatically through experience.

name: Deep Learning
description: A subset of machine learning involving neural networks with multiple layers.

name: Natural Language Processing (NLP)
description: Interaction between computers and humans in natural language.

name: Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs)
description: Technique to generate new data similar to training data.

name: Reinforcement Learning
description: Learning by trial and error with rewards or punishments.

name: AI Chatbots
description: Conversational agents for customer service, information, entertainment.

name: Industrial Robots
description: Automate manufacturing processes.

name: Humanoid Robots
description: Robots designed to mimic human body movements.

name: Autonomous Vehicles
description: Self-driving cars, drones, etc.

name: Robotic Surgery Systems
description: Enhances precision in surgical operations.

name: Exoskeletons
description: Wearable devices to assist or enhance human movement.

name: Soft Robotics
description: Robots constructed from compliant materials, often mimicking biological systems.

name: LEDs (Light Emitting Diodes)
description: Energy-efficient lighting.

name: OLED (Organic LED)
description: Display technology with high contrast and flexibility.

name: Quantum Dots
description: Used in displays for improved color reproduction.

name: Bluetooth
description: Short-range wireless technology.

name: Wi-Fi
description: Wireless networking technology.

name: USB (Universal Serial Bus)
description: Standard for cable and connectors.

name: SSD (Solid State Drive)
description: Flash storage devices that significantly speed up data access.

name: Version Control Systems
description: Manages changes to documents, programs, etc.

name: Containerization (Docker)
description: Operating system-level virtualization for deploying software.

name: Blockchain
description: Secure way to record transactions and maintain a ledger.

name: Voice Recognition Software
description: Converts spoken words into written text or commands.

name: Big Data Technologies
description: Tools for handling large volumes of data (e.g., Hadoop, Spark).

name: Cybersecurity Solutions
description: Encryption, firewalls, intrusion detection systems.

name: IoT (Internet of Things)
description: Network of interconnected devices.

name: Quantum Computing
description: Uses quantum-mechanical phenomena for computation.
